This game is super awesome and legit; I highly recommend it. If you don't have a mouse at all, it's still easy to play. I can customize my character, and there's a tutorial on how to shoot, interact, and operate the whole game. its better if you're as young as 13+ to play it because of the maturity. not anything subliminal, but it's age-appropriate. for example, it's harder to teach a 3-year-old what an 8-year-old knows, you know? That's what I mean by age-appropriate. There's soft gore, and the makeup of the whole system is fluid and runs smoothly for many PCs. I played this game for 36 hours accidentally and it was worth every minute. i also noticed that its a 1st POV, so its a storyline like Dying Light. except you read it (as it pauses even if you're attacked, no damages because you're paused reading the story or dialog) like dialog in mobile apps. tbh this game is boss mode and i love it completely. one can even change the difficulty. now i havent finished the game, but i can tell im gonna love the thrill of killing these zombies! they're so easy to kill.

One of the Games of All Time. It is aggressively apparent that it's a mobile game, and a mid one at that. I normally try to stay positive but it's super boring. There's no risk, especially when you are gifted a purple tier shotgun 10 minutes in. You don't really take damage, getting shot in the face deals 1-2 damage of your 250+ Health pool. Zombies are slow and get staggered very easily if they survive more than one hit.
Game makes you play to level 10 to play with friends and sucks. Most mobile game are of better quality.

like a looter shooter for your phone but on pc. poor graphics. npcs are to easy. tutorial makes you follow a story line when all you want to do is learn how to shoot loot and move. Game was going great until all of a sudden  you start losing gear when you die.  No you can't even go back and recover them.  A game breaking mechanic like that ended the game for me.  These weapons can take dozens of hours of farming to just have them disappear completely. Until they fix that the game is unplayable.  Has to be the dumbest game mechanic i have ever seen.

For example: I have cloths and weapons for teammate with lower level, but cant give it to him. - the game simply has lack of team spirit as it was planned to be solo marauder play style. It ruins it for us. although overall it could be nice game with potential, but we have what we have.

This game has the potential to be a great survival Looter Shooter game however it is highly let down by the sheer greed and lack of care by the development team. 

The game itself has many great facets and the single player/story line part of the game is quite good and the going from level 1 to 40 is enjoyable.

Here is where it goes down hill from there and I'll provide examples and feedback.

I have onver 1700 hours playing this game over the last 4 months and myself and others have provided many suggestions in the discord suggestion channel about how to improve areas of the game. Much of this feedback is responded to by the DD_Team who are quite helpful and pass our direct feedback on to the developers. Unfortunately that's where it stops and the developers have zero interest in listening and catering to their player base and have repeatedly ignored player requests to fix several key issues within the game.

The biggest key issue being the upgrade system within the game. For new players thinking of playing this game, look elsewhere because once you hit level 40, there are quite a few roadblocks because of the upgrade system. Your first upgrade os 100% success rate and it then goes downhill from there, level 2 on your weapon becomes 50% success rate and here's the tricky part, it's not fail once and then guaranteed the second time, it's 50% success rate every time. Many players have attempted for over 8 times to upgrade their weapon to +2 or +3 and have failed 8 times straight, every upgrade costs money, ER and an upgrade box and depending on what grade of weapon/armour you are trying to upgrade, the materials required are higher. 

Here's where it gets even worse. When you go from +2 to +3 on your weapon and are successful, every other attempt you have and fail, you'r weapon will downgrade back to a +2 being hte lowest it can go. So if you are lucky enough to get a weapon to +5 and want to attempt a +6 upgrade (which has a 25% success rate) and that upgrade fails, you will go down to a +4, if you again attempt to re upgrade back to +5 and fail again, it becomes a +3 and if you fail again, you are down to a +2.

Basically you could spend 2 days farming to upgrade your weapon and end up worse off than you were to begin with. The flow on effect of this is, there are numerous daily raids and the higher you rank by doing more damage, the better rewards you receive and when your gear drops damage dramatically, you have very little chance of making the top 10 or within the top 5.

Also, within the new area they have released, it drops weapon and armour blueprint fragments which you require 100 to convert to being able to craft that item. Here''s the best part, you require level 9 or level 10 Forge facility to 1, be able to craft the blueprint, and 2. be able to make the item. And to make the item, you require titanium or nano fiber which never drops. Out of the 1700 hours played and constant grinding i've done in the game, I've managed to obtain 5 titanium and 4 nano fiber. 3 of each ot these were obtaned from the final quest line so in essence, out of 1700 hours played and farmed, i've obtained 2 titanium and 1 nano fiber and when you need 66 of each for shelter level 10, it would take years to be able to do, let alone be able to craft an item. They have set the game up to the point where you need to purchase red diamonds with real money and then purchase items off the exchange with red diamonds. You can also use real money to purchase ER and weapon upgrade boxes. Again all set up for pay to win and spend as much as you can to make the developers rich. What's worse for the paid players is they can spend all that money on buying rubbish level 40 SSR weapons to decompose for the weapon upgrade kits and have them constantly fail or downgrade their high level weapon that some have paid over $500 in real money by buying red diamonds to purchase the items.

They have also created a new area where the moster levels are vase line lvl 46. Now you can only get to level 40 and your weapon is level 40 so you need a +5 green weapon N grade to be doing full damage or able to kill the lvl 46 mobs. If your weapon has been downgraded to a +2 through trying to upgrade, you are rendered useless in that area and can't farm there.

The next biggest issue players have is the extremely low drop rate of titanium and nano fiber which is used to go to shelter level 10. you need 66 of each and even the top level players have not been able to achieve this since playing from launch nearly 6 months ago. 

They also have facility mods which drop quite often but are basically an ornament in your locker because you require level 10 shelter and lvl 10 facility of each certain facility to use them, Again, due to the extremely low drop rate of higher end blueprints, not one person in the game after 6 months has a level 10 facility to even be able to use a facility mod.

Players have been pleading for well over 3 months to fix these key issues and the developers have constantly ignored the player base requests and feedback to the point where now hundreds of players have stopped playing and therefore trying to fill raids has become quite difficult as the raids are region locked. It's to the point where players are using a vpn to "server hop" to find a full server. This in itself is another issue the players have requested be addressed and the raids merge and fill and a new one starts when the first one is full however has also fallen on deaf ears.

What the developers have become really good at in this game is releasing a new pet, new resident, new vehicle, new armour or new weapons for players to purchse (with real money of course) and their only focus is what new item or pet can they release so people spend money in the game. 

The saddest part is, if they fixed the above key issues, they would have a higher player base and more people would put money into the game but unfortunately they don't see it that way and their sheer greed is slowly ruining what could be quite a great game.

My best advice, either avoid this game until they fix these key issues, or just play very casually for the story line and forget about trying to do much after level 40. Don't waste your real money on a game that wants to set you up to fail and suck you in like a gambling machine with their upgrade system.

IGN: Wokafella

This game is not worth a look. It has a broken upgrade system, you can sink many hours into grinding to get fail after fail on upgrade attempts. I have over 100 upgrade kits into a sr weapon and it is curently  a plus 2. with six straight failed attempts in a row.The patch they just recently did broke the residents they do very little damage now. There update seems to punish honest players. lontree tuneel  is a main game mode and now it is limited to 3 times a day. sun flowers you kill to get er and reward now spawn zombies to kill and get no reward . that makes it even more of a grind for even less of a reward. then after long sessions of endless grinding you get to go spend the fruits of your labor to watch the downgrades roll in.... this game is in a really bad state. it does not seem to get any better..seems to get worse with every update.

Sure, you can play for free. It is nice mix of State of Decay and MMO. You will get tired quickly tho. It is early access right now and doesn't have much of a content to keep you. Not mention their prices for things in the game. I mean real life money dollars. They don't know that not everyone on this forsaken planet use dollars.

This is another game that uses [b]AI ART AND DOES NOT DISCLOSE IT.[/b]

There's a very low chance you are playing this game anyways, the story is very generic and the mobile like elements such as "click-here" tutorialization, daily log-in rewards, cumulative log-in rewards, level-up rewards and so and so forth have put you back already.

If they haven't then don't play this game, most of the assets seem AI generated, the definitive proof came from the Taxi vehicle you obtain at Level 8. If the lack of a soul in a game is alright to you then, the shooting is mediocre, the driving is mediocre, the missions are alright, the skins are gooner bait and the jrapics are mobile-esque which means even having an RTX 4060 will not help this game from still looking like ass.

TLDR; It's a mediocre game with generative AI art.

P.S. The boys and I will [b][u]NOT[/u][/b] be playing this one.

Darkest Days by NHN is, without exaggeration, one of the most profoundly boring and painfully uninspired games I have ever subjected myself to. Calling it a ‚Äúgame‚Äù feels generous. It‚Äôs more like an accidental screensaver that somehow ended up on Steam.

The core mechanics‚Äîif you can call them that‚Äîare an absolute disaster. Every system feels like it was duct-taped together during a coffee break, then abandoned without a second thought. Combat is sluggish, progression is meaningless, and every moment spent trying to understand why anything works the way it does feels like a personal attack on your free time. Nothing fits, nothing satisfies, and nothing ever evolves into something worth caring about.

The boredom is so dense you could bottle it. I‚Äôve had more thrilling experiences watching paint dry, because at least the paint eventually changes.

This entire experience reeks of a lazily shoveled mobile port smashed onto PC without the smallest attempt at optimization, refinement, or even respect for the platform. Menus feel like they were ripped straight from a phone UI, slapped onto a PC screen, and left there, unapologetic and confused. It‚Äôs as if someone said, ‚ÄúEh, they‚Äôll deal with it,‚Äù and called it a day.

Every minute I spent with Darkest Days is a minute I wish I could reclaim. If time is the most precious resource we have, this game is a vacuum‚Äîan all-consuming void where hours go to die.

And honestly? Anything would be better than this. Folding laundry. Reorganizing cables. Counting ceiling tiles. Watching grass grow in real time. There is no activity so mundane that it wouldn‚Äôt feel like a dazzling thrill ride compared to this dung heap of a title.

Darkest Days has no redeeming qualities‚Äînone. Zero. It is the gaming equivalent of a shrug followed by a sigh followed by silence. Its the equivalent of a home where Dad went out to get cigarettes and didn't come home, if Dad called you and said "Screw this I'm leaving" And your five year old little self is just sitting there in your crappy diaper wondering wtf just even happened.

If you value your time, sanity, or pulse rate, play literally anything else. ANYTHING.

Ok so after 35 hours this game is.. Meh. Love this genre, but this game is lacking in certain areas. Endless fetch and clear quests for these communities that give you a tiny buff if you upgrade them. Also, no visual progression as the communities rebuild them with your help, just the same bland NPC's wandering about. No building to speak of, you can place down crafting/buff stations in your "base" but theres no visual progression when you upgrade those either. The whole game it just seems like no point in playing it. Time waster only.

- world design is fine but because of the controls and the mobile game design it feels dull

pros:
- free to download
- is a zombie game
- ok graphics
- if you can stomach the way it is delivered there is apocalyptic fun to be had.

This game has the potential to be a great survival Looter Shooter game however it is highly let down by the sheer greed and lack of care by the development team. 

The game itself has many great facets and the single player/story line part of the game is quite good and the going from level 1 to 40 is enjoyable.

Here is where it goes down hill from there and I'll provide examples and feedback.

I have onver 1700 hours playing this game over the last 4 months and myself and others have provided many suggestions in the discord suggestion channel about how to improve areas of the game. Much of this feedback is responded to by the DD_Team who are quite helpful and pass our direct feedback on to the developers. Unfortunately that's where it stops and the developers have zero interest in listening and catering to their player base and have repeatedly ignored player requests to fix several key issues within the game.

The biggest key issue being the upgrade system within the game. For new players thinking of playing this game, look elsewhere because once you hit level 40, there are quite a few roadblocks because of the upgrade system. Your first upgrade os 100% success rate and it then goes downhill from there, level 2 on your weapon becomes 50% success rate and here's the tricky part, it's not fail once and then guaranteed the second time, it's 50% success rate every time. Many players have attempted for over 8 times to upgrade their weapon to +2 or +3 and have failed 8 times straight, every upgrade costs money, ER and an upgrade box and depending on what grade of weapon/armour you are trying to upgrade, the materials required are higher. 

Here's where it gets even worse. When you go from +2 to +3 on your weapon and are successful, every other attempt you have and fail, you'r weapon will downgrade back to a +2 being hte lowest it can go. So if you are lucky enough to get a weapon to +5 and want to attempt a +6 upgrade (which has a 25% success rate) and that upgrade fails, you will go down to a +4, if you again attempt to re upgrade back to +5 and fail again, it becomes a +3 and if you fail again, you are down to a +2.

Basically you could spend 2 days farming to upgrade your weapon and end up worse off than you were to begin with. The flow on effect of this is, there are numerous daily raids and the higher you rank by doing more damage, the better rewards you receive and when your gear drops damage dramatically, you have very little chance of making the top 10 or within the top 5.

Also, within the new area they have released, it drops weapon and armour blueprint fragments which you require 100 to convert to being able to craft that item. Here''s the best part, you require level 9 or level 10 Forge facility to 1, be able to craft the blueprint, and 2. be able to make the item. And to make the item, you require titanium or nano fiber which never drops. Out of the 1700 hours played and constant grinding i've done in the game, I've managed to obtain 5 titanium and 4 nano fiber. 3 of each ot these were obtaned from the final quest line so in essence, out of 1700 hours played and farmed, i've obtained 2 titanium and 1 nano fiber and when you need 66 of each for shelter level 10, it would take years to be able to do, let alone be able to craft an item. They have set the game up to the point where you need to purchase red diamonds with real money and then purchase items off the exchange with red diamonds. You can also use real money to purchase ER and weapon upgrade boxes. Again all set up for pay to win and spend as much as you can to make the developers rich. What's worse for the paid players is they can spend all that money on buying rubbish level 40 SSR weapons to decompose for the weapon upgrade kits and have them constantly fail or downgrade their high level weapon that some have paid over $500 in real money by buying red diamonds to purchase the items.

They have also created a new area where the moster levels are vase line lvl 46. Now you can only get to level 40 and your weapon is level 40 so you need a +5 green weapon N grade to be doing full damage or able to kill the lvl 46 mobs. If your weapon has been downgraded to a +2 through trying to upgrade, you are rendered useless in that area and can't farm there.

The next biggest issue players have is the extremely low drop rate of titanium and nano fiber which is used to go to shelter level 10. you need 66 of each and even the top level players have not been able to achieve this since playing from launch nearly 6 months ago. 

They also have facility mods which drop quite often but are basically an ornament in your locker because you require level 10 shelter and lvl 10 facility of each certain facility to use them, Again, due to the extremely low drop rate of higher end blueprints, not one person in the game after 6 months has a level 10 facility to even be able to use a facility mod.

Players have been pleading for well over 3 months to fix these key issues and the developers have constantly ignored the player base requests and feedback to the point where now hundreds of players have stopped playing and therefore trying to fill raids has become quite difficult as the raids are region locked. It's to the point where players are using a vpn to "server hop" to find a full server. This in itself is another issue the players have requested be addressed and the raids merge and fill and a new one starts when the first one is full however has also fallen on deaf ears.

What the developers have become really good at in this game is releasing a new pet, new resident, new vehicle, new armour or new weapons for players to purchse (with real money of course) and their only focus is what new item or pet can they release so people spend money in the game. 

The saddest part is, if they fixed the above key issues, they would have a higher player base and more people would put money into the game but unfortunately they don't see it that way and their sheer greed is slowly ruining what could be quite a great game.

My best advice, either avoid this game until they fix these key issues, or just play very casually for the story line and forget about trying to do much after level 40. Don't waste your real money on a game that wants to set you up to fail and suck you in like a gambling machine with their upgrade system.

IGN: Wokafella

This game is not worth a look. It has a broken upgrade system, you can sink many hours into grinding to get fail after fail on upgrade attempts. I have over 100 upgrade kits into a sr weapon and it is curently  a plus 2. with six straight failed attempts in a row.The patch they just recently did broke the residents they do very little damage now. There update seems to punish honest players. lontree tuneel  is a main game mode and now it is limited to 3 times a day. sun flowers you kill to get er and reward now spawn zombies to kill and get no reward . that makes it even more of a grind for even less of a reward. then after long sessions of endless grinding you get to go spend the fruits of your labor to watch the downgrades roll in.... this game is in a really bad state. it does not seem to get any better..seems to get worse with every update.

Sure, you can play for free. It is nice mix of State of Decay and MMO. You will get tired quickly tho. It is early access right now and doesn't have much of a content to keep you. Not mention their prices for things in the game. I mean real life money dollars. They don't know that not everyone on this forsaken planet use dollars.

This is another game that uses [b]AI ART AND DOES NOT DISCLOSE IT.[/b]

There's a very low chance you are playing this game anyways, the story is very generic and the mobile like elements such as "click-here" tutorialization, daily log-in rewards, cumulative log-in rewards, level-up rewards and so and so forth have put you back already.

If they haven't then don't play this game, most of the assets seem AI generated, the definitive proof came from the Taxi vehicle you obtain at Level 8. If the lack of a soul in a game is alright to you then, the shooting is mediocre, the driving is mediocre, the missions are alright, the skins are gooner bait and the jrapics are mobile-esque which means even having an RTX 4060 will not help this game from still looking like ass.

TLDR; It's a mediocre game with generative AI art.

P.S. The boys and I will [b][u]NOT[/u][/b] be playing this one.

Darkest Days by NHN is, without exaggeration, one of the most profoundly boring and painfully uninspired games I have ever subjected myself to. Calling it a ‚Äúgame‚Äù feels generous. It‚Äôs more like an accidental screensaver that somehow ended up on Steam.

The core mechanics‚Äîif you can call them that‚Äîare an absolute disaster. Every system feels like it was duct-taped together during a coffee break, then abandoned without a second thought. Combat is sluggish, progression is meaningless, and every moment spent trying to understand why anything works the way it does feels like a personal attack on your free time. Nothing fits, nothing satisfies, and nothing ever evolves into something worth caring about.

The boredom is so dense you could bottle it. I‚Äôve had more thrilling experiences watching paint dry, because at least the paint eventually changes.

This entire experience reeks of a lazily shoveled mobile port smashed onto PC without the smallest attempt at optimization, refinement, or even respect for the platform. Menus feel like they were ripped straight from a phone UI, slapped onto a PC screen, and left there, unapologetic and confused. It‚Äôs as if someone said, ‚ÄúEh, they‚Äôll deal with it,‚Äù and called it a day.

Every minute I spent with Darkest Days is a minute I wish I could reclaim. If time is the most precious resource we have, this game is a vacuum‚Äîan all-consuming void where hours go to die.

And honestly? Anything would be better than this. Folding laundry. Reorganizing cables. Counting ceiling tiles. Watching grass grow in real time. There is no activity so mundane that it wouldn‚Äôt feel like a dazzling thrill ride compared to this dung heap of a title.

Darkest Days has no redeeming qualities‚Äînone. Zero. It is the gaming equivalent of a shrug followed by a sigh followed by silence. Its the equivalent of a home where Dad went out to get cigarettes and didn't come home, if Dad called you and said "Screw this I'm leaving" And your five year old little self is just sitting there in your crappy diaper wondering wtf just even happened.

If you value your time, sanity, or pulse rate, play literally anything else. ANYTHING.
